subject: Re: [junit] WebBased Testing using JUNIT
msgSnippet: ... In principle you could do it without httpunit, if you implement a lot of stuff that s already in httpunit yourself. But installing httpunit and learning to
messageBody:
love wrote:

> Can I do Web Based testing on say, "http://lava:8081/mypage" by using
> JUNIT to click my JSP buttons, fill in texts, ...
> and not using httpunit?
>
> If there are ways out please reply to this Newbie soon.

In principle you could do it without httpunit, if you implement a lot of
stuff that's already in httpunit yourself. But installing httpunit and
learning to use it is a lot more efficient. Why don't you use httpunit?
JUnit by itself doesn't have functionality to do want you want to do.

--
Mark Van Peteghem
http://www.q-mentum.com -- easier and more powerful unit testing
